BOT - Reverted edits by [[Special:contributions/168.216.33.48|168.216.33.48]] {[[User:VoABot_II/Help#Revert_reasons|open ports]]} to revision #155832065 by "VoABot II". [needs review]
BOT - Reverted edits by [[Special:contributions/168.216.33.48|168.216.33.48]] {[[User:VoABot_II/Help#Revert_reasons|open ports]]} to revision #155763717 by "C.J. Griffin". [needs review]
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ replaced POV and technically untrue 'murdered' with 'killed'. Executions and war deaths in wikipedia articles are not generally termed as 'murders'
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ Black Book not reliable source - even some of its own editors publically disowned it as propagandist in intent
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ reason for Lenin's so-called 'hanging order' - with references
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ restored non-speculative numbers executed by Cheka - taken from primary and secondary sources
Re-arranged things on red terror section and added materials with proper citations. Removed POV copy and paste job of Socialist ramblings (Christopher Marsden) from a Socialist website (WSWS).
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ minor corrections
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ references
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ circumstances surrounding 'Lenin's Hanging Order'
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ number of Cheka executions
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ Added numbers of clergy killed in 1922 anti-clerical campaigns with source.
Added scholarly source on Cheka killings
/* Return to Russia */ it was not a "bolshevik upprising" in July - (it was more of an anarchist thing) Lenin was against the July uprising, saying the time was not ready yet - Read Lenin!!!

/* Return to Russia */ error - Trotsky was never a "Menshevik" - he was party less (supported the Mensheviks in some questions, the bolshevik in others), but he finally joined the B after the feb revo
/* Return to Russia */ wrong to say that the feb revolution "caught Lenin by surprise" - he knew the war would lead to revolutions, that's what the Zimmerwald Left predicted
/* Revolutionary activity, travel and exile */ on Plechanov
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ text is a translation - Lenin wrote in Russian!
/* After death */ more detail on circumstances of renaming Leningrad
/* Lenin's stance on anti-Semitism */ more on Lenin's gramophone recordings
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ citation needed
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ deleted irrelevent stuff about what Stalin did later in completely different circumstances after Lenin was long dead - this article is about Lenin not Stalin
